text.KPI name and description:
Extent to which supplier is responsive and flexible to FCDO and other stakeholder needs.
   Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
   •            6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   •            5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   •            4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   •            3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   •            2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   •            1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
   – KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract

   Scoring is determined on the basis of supplier performance in FCDO's Annual Supplier Scorecards which has a percentage scoring system will incur a 'good' rating if more than 80%, whilst scores of 50-79% approaching target; 30-49% will require improvement and <30% will incur an 'inadequate' rating.

text.KPI name and description: Identify and tackle inequality in employment, skills and pay in the contract workforce and Supplier’s own organisation
text.Good target: Method Statement as detailed in Supplier’s response to the Social Value Question at ITT stage is kept to. The supplier can demonstrate that, in line with timelines specified in the Method Statement, that “action is agreed upon. The action could come in the form of a positive action scheme, a pay review, the identification of training, or a change in policy.  The director who conducted the audit is responsible for the actions. All the directors then have a chance to feedback on the process and methods.” The supplier demonstrates, on a quarterly basis, that the Method Statement is being acted upon. By each performance review, the supplier provides a further report on the “Related Practices and Activities” that have transpired since contract start which demonstrate measures are being taken to meet the Tackling Workforce Inequality Key Indicator. Reporting relating to the metrics defined above are delayed by no more than 5 working days.

text.Contract title and description: HO Central Postal Services-Premium
text.KPI name and description: End-to-End Deliveries - On-time mailing delivery to the recipient.
text.Comments:
Over the quarter from 27 March to 25 June 2023, Royal Mail delivered 94.3% of Second Class mail within three working days and 74.6% of First Class mail within one working day. High levels of staff absence and vacancies, amongst other factors, have affected operational performance and quality of service levels in Q1. 
Improving quality of service is one of Royal Mail’s top priorities. Plans to improve quality are already underway with targeted recruitment drives and a dedicated highly skilled performance team working with local units to improve quality.
The Business Recovery, Transformation and Growth Agreement - which was approved by a ballot of CWU members in July - provides a platform to improve operational performance and reduce absence. This includes new attendance and sickness policies, network changes and new seasonal working patterns to improve quality of service. 
Improving quality of service is a top priority. Royal Mail’s primary focus is to restore performance and deliver the high standards of service our customers expect.

text.KPI name and description:
Quality of products
   Products are delivered following relevant IDS quality assurance and signed off by FCDO SRO. Four criteria:
   1) BASIC Research has submitted evidence of responses to:
   a. 2 internal reviews of products (at least 1 reviewer with 10+ years experience)
   b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)
   Product then submitted to FCDO as part of quarterly report usually on the final day of the quarter. 
   Steps 2, 3 and 4 to occur after that deadline.
   2) BASIC Research has responded to FCDO reviews
   3) FCDO deems the product to be within the agreed* scope in terms of planned purpose and content
   4) FCDO signs off the product
text.Good target: When FCDO signs off the product the full amount of funds linked to that product will be released.

text.Contract title and description: CSSF:Global Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning
text.KPI name and description: % programme expenditure on technical delivery compared to programme management to maximise efficiency in GMEL delivery.
text.Comments: During Q1, GMEL Partnership has been delivering with an increased percentage split level of programme management than the previous quarter.  This is due to the need to maintain support to CSSF's Evidence and Data Hub (EDH) during an extended strategic planning and prioritisation period while some technical delivery has reduced during the design and transition of CSSF to ISF. This has been highlighted by GMEL at the EDH monthly delivery management meetings and partnership quarterly steering boards and discussed and managed before and during the monitoring of this KPI quarter.  EDH have agreed and approved the need to maintain appropriate programme management and the internally adjusted expectation of a higher percentage of programme management during this period. This is expected to a temporary lift, while pipeline and strategy gets developed, and delivery gets underway and will be managed accordingly.
